chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius Jamal Exum

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius Jamal Exum in court.  
Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Demetrius Jamal Exum.  
Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference.
Defense advises the court defendant is seeking to hire private counsel.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 for a status of counsel. 
This hearing will be held  In person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Demetrius Jamal Exum in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Demetrius Jamal Exum.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case set for a scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and offer. Defense needs time to review discovery with client. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Brank 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Demetrius Jamal Exum in court, appear in person with attorney Katherine Graber, appear by video. Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective S. Seitz.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Demetrius Jamal Exum in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Demetrius Jamal Exum in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demetrius Jamal Exum appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
